# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    start_index = 1
    for i in eachindex(text)
        if (i - start_index + 1) > text_width
            push!(lines, text[start_index:i-1])
            start_index = i + 1
        end
    end
    push!(lines, text[start_index:end])
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello world this is a very long sentence that should be wrapped to fit within 10 characters per line.")
"Hello world\nthis is a very long\nsentence that should be\nwrapped to fit within\n10 characters per line."
```
